repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript belonged to Édouard-Simon Ariel (1818-1854). It contains a total of 564 verb roots that are subdivided into seven different booklets, each starting with an intertitle-page, according to their initial letter. Letters run from ந to வ.
BnF Indien 160 is the preceding volume where Tamil roots start from the letter a.
Description based on the digitized version.

support.p: As in manuscript BnF Indien 194 from the same author, different kinds of paper are found: a) brownish and thick paper; b) a light yellowish colour; c) a darker yellowish colour paper. Two other kinds of paper are also found: a) a light blue colour and b) ruled paper. Examples of these latter kinds of paper can be found at ff. 123, 197, 202, 205, 224, 250, 279, 282, 289, 299, etc. Even the size of the paper may differ. Hence, one finds not only pages which are smaller, but also different sized paper resembling notes, sometimes written in the light blue colour paper and pasted on the main page as if they were an errata corrige. Examples can be see at ff. 58r, 294r.

extent.measure: 1 + 564 + 1 (u1 + U1 + u2). 1 front guard leaf + 564 + 1 back guard leaf.

foliation.p: Foliation starts with the number one and it is regularly found on the upper right side of the recto of each folio. From f306 onwards, often 2 or 3 folios (each with their own foliation) have been glued together so as to appear as a single folio. See f307-309, f310-311, etc.
There are only few occurrences in which there is another (erased or not) number next to the one representing the main foliation. For instance f80 also bears foliation 347.

collation.desc: the front cover. Shelfmark on recto.
2 folios = front guard leaves. No foliation. 220 x 350 mm. Shelfmark on f[1]r. Verso blank. Element of binding.

564 folios = Radicaux tamils 2. Various sizes but no exceding 220 x 350 mm. Smaller folios have been glued together probably when rebinding the volume. The verso are left blank unless it is a reused folio (what was written earlier is deleted on the new verso) or unless the description of the Tamil verb root on the recto continues on the verso (see e.g. ff. 3, 10, 15, 18, 23, 52, 55, 63, 65, 66, 69, etc.).
1 folios = back guard leaf. 220 x 350 mm. No foliation. Element of binding.

layoutDesc.layout: The layout of the page is not organised. There are many erasure marks.

handNote.desc: The handwriting by Edouard Ariel is difficult to read. For some verb root, a Sanskrit corresponding form written in Devanagari script is provided. Examples may be found at ff. 53r, 54r, 78r, 84r, 89r, 130r, 236r, 253r.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 161 (front cover, verso).

There are two different stamps found at the beginning and at the end of each booklet. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the writing BIBLIOTHEQUE IMPERIALE MSS.. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing DON n°. Example of this combination can be found at ff. 137r, 226r, 367r. The number of donation is not specified, however the handwriting, as well as the paper used allow to identify it as a manuscript belonging to Ariel whose collection was transferred from the Société Asiatique to the BnF in 1866 (Berthier 2000: 61). In some other cases only the first stamp is found like at ff. 224v, 365v.
Old shelfmark in red pencil: Tamoul 159 (f[1]r).

Intertitles on their own page:
Radicaux tamils. த. (f1r). This booklet includes 138 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils ந. (f136r). This booklet includes 88 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. ப. (f225r). This booklet includes 140 verb forms.
Radicaux tamils. ம. (f366r). This booklet includes 90 verb forms.

Radicaux tamils. ய. (f460r). This booklet includes 3 verb forms.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outside. Collection of loose folios, sometimes of different size and colours, collected together.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Being a manusript by Ariel, the date of composition is based on his permanence in Pondicherry where he arrived in 1844 as a French Marine Officer after having studied with Eugène Burnof (1801-1852) in Paris (see James 2000: 198-199).

acquisition.p: It entered the Bibliothèque Nationale with Ariel's collection in 1866 (see Berthier 2000: 61).
